meanings.definition: Bad-tempered or difficult to deal with.
meanings.sent1: The cat was the orneriest animal in the shelter, always hissing at everyone.
meanings.sent2: She became the orneriest when she was hungry and didn't get her favorite snack.
meanings.sent3: The orneriest squirrel in the park stole all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: His car was the orneriest beast on the road, constantly breaking down.
meanings.sent5: The orneriest storm of the season flooded the streets and caused chaos.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of respect or good manners.
meanings.sent1: The orneriest student in class always talked back to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: He gave the orneriest reply when asked to help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: The orneriest guest at the party kept interrupting others while they were speaking.
meanings.sent4: Her orneriest behavior at the meeting shocked everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The orneriest customer in the store demanded to speak to the manager.

meanings.definition: Characterized by stubbornness or a tendency to be contrary.
meanings.sent1: The orneriest mule on the farm refused to move no matter what.
meanings.sent2: She showed her orneriest side when asked to change her opinion.
meanings.sent3: The orneriest child in the family insisted on wearing mismatched socks to school.
meanings.sent4: His orneriest habit was always taking the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent5: The orneriest tree in the forest stood tall despite the strong winds.
